channel.title: Updating?
channel.description:
Okay here goes.
Ive got my bot and it works but now runescape has updated I need to update it. So i use my first updater (made by oliie and ace) and get JaGeX.update and replace it with my old one. Then i use my seccond updater (well its not mine its silver linings) and I run it and get runescape.jar (370) and get this in the cmd prompt:
[code] Entity.LoopCycleStatus : ha.Yb Entity.Height : ha.Wb Entity.Animation : ha.ac Entity.Y : ha.gc Entity.X : ha.Ub Entity.SmallX : ha.Fb Entity.SmallY : ha.ic Entity.Message : ha.uc RSString.Bytes : sc.e Player.Name : hd.Yc Player.PKHeadIcon : ha.Cc Player.PrayerHeadIcon : ha.Cc Player.Team : ha.Dc Player.CombatLevel : hd.md Player.ModelID : hd.qd Entity.TurnDirection : ha.ec NPC.Def : hb.Vc NPCDef.ID : id.Ob NPCDef.Name : id.db NPCDef.Actions : id.Jb Animable.ModelHeight : wc.rb RSInterface.InventoryArray : he.Sb RSInterface.InventoryStackArray : he.Zc RSInterface.Type : he.Lb RSInterface.AtActionType : he.ad RSInterface.Width : he.cc RSInterface.Height : he.lb RSInterface.Actions : he.D RSInterface.Message : he.pb RSInterface.SelectedAction : he.Rc RSInterface.SpellName : he.Mc RSInterface.Tooltip : he.Kb Item.ID : a.vb Item.StackSize : a.Ab Node.Previous : ce.e Node.Next : ce.i Node.ID : ce.b NodeSub.PreviousSub : gd.M NodeSub.NextSub : gd.O NodeList.Current : sb.g NodeList.Current : sb.v TerrainInt : e.i GroundIntArray : hf.l SettingsArray : sa.d MouseX : ba.L MouseY : kc.Z CameraCurveX : wc.nb CameraCurveY : a.Bb PlayerValids : jc.l PlayerArray : pb.kb GroundByteArray : pf.N CameraX : va.o CameraY : a.tb CameraZ : jc.a LoopCycle : e.j Entity.CurrentHP : ha.xb Entity.MaximumHP : ha.mc NPCArray : nb.A NPCValids : hf.k Entity.InteractingEntity : ha.ac LoginIndex : qe.j WorldController : wa.A GroundArray : be.J Object1 : ra.gb Object1UID : f.c Object2 : ra.S Object2UID : kf.v Object3 : ra.cb Object3UID : wd.j Object4 : ra.I Object4UID : de.g Object5UID : ub.u Object5Array : ra.eb NodeListArray : rf.a Updating completed in 4969 milliseconds. [/code]
Now that ive got this info what do i do with it to update my bot? Thanks for the help. I hope ive porvided all the correct info.

item.title: Updating?
item.dc:creator: @pko pko

@pko wrote:

I was gonna say that exactly!

Mopar beat me!

Read full topic

item.title: Updating?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I will attempt to help you out here, but do realize this will still require a decent amount of coding on your part, so it isn’t exactly spoon feeding.

If you look at the ClassEditor class from cherokee here:
http://cherokeeengine.svn.sourceforge.net/viewvc/cherokeeengine/src/com/cherokee/rs/rs2/ClassEditor.java?view=markup

That will load configuration from an InputStream in this format:
http://cherokeeengine.svn.sourceforge.net/viewvc/cherokeeengine/update.log?view=markup

And will then edit the classes to be used at runtime or dumped into a jar or folder. Goodluck.

Read full topic

item.title: Updating?
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

taj3430:

So will i need to use the infermation from the fields list i got from the updater?

Yes. Bot operation has three general steps:

  1. Identify the game state
  2. Choose a response
  3. Respond

The standard purpose of an updater is to locate the classes, fields, and methods that a bot uses to find information about the game state (step 1) and to generate and send false input (maybe step 3, depending on your design). Since all bots do these things in slightly differing ways, updaters for any particular bot tend to be incompatible with those of other bots.

If you would let us know more about how your bot works, we could perhaps give you more useful advice on how to maintain it.

Read full topic

item.title: Updating?
item.dc:creator: @taj3430 taj3430
item.description:

item.title: Updating?
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

the packets get changed, the identifiers get changed, the classes get changed, the methods appear to get changed

any decent updater will be written specifically for its bot, as there are many ways in which fields can be accessed (if you want to access fields)

learn the client, write your bot, write your own updater

Read full topic

item.title: Updating?
item.dc:creator: @taj3430 taj3430
item.description:
@taj3430 wrote:

Acctually i have the bot allready sorted and i beleive that the updaters get the packets that have changed? Correct me if im wrong but im interested in updating a bot and i need to start somewhere so some help would be greatly appriciated.

Read full topic

item.title: Updating?
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

[quote=“taj3430, post:1, topic:139288”]Okay here goes.

I have leeched two updaters and have absolutely no knowledge of what they actually do. Please tell me how I can run aryan with it, or give me a bot that will be able to use these two completely different styles of information. Please not that I do not know how to maintain these, so I will be posting again when they break. I will also attach a list of generic fields so that at a glace it appears that I have some idea what I am doing, you however, will be frustrated by having read another useless post and wonder what the hell is wrong with the cheating scene. Here you have it people, I am a shining example of what is wrong with it![/quote]amirite

Read full topic
